2026-02-17.content: New best practices are available for securing generative AI agents using Model Context Protocol (MCP) with Google Cloud databases. This guide covers key security measures like least privilege, native database controls, and secure agent design to help you build safer AI applications. For more information, see [Best practices for securing agent interactions with Model Context Protocol](https://docs.cloud.google.com/firestore/native/docs/secure-agent-interactions-mcp).

summary.title: Secure Generative AI Agents with MCP
summary.summary: New best practices guide you on securing generative AI agents using Model Context Protocol (MCP) with Google Cloud databases. Learn about least privilege, native database controls, and secure agent design to build safer AI applications.

2026-02-17.content:
Control of MCP use with organization policies is deprecated. After March 17,
2026, organization policies that use the `gcp.managed.allowedMCPServices`
constraint won't work, and you can control MCP use with IAM deny policies. For
more information about controlling MCP use, see
[Control MCP use with IAM](https://docs.cloud.google.com/mcp/control-mcp-use-iam).

summary.title: MCP Use Control Deprecation
summary.summary: Control of MCP use with organization policies is deprecated and will stop working after March 17, 2026. You should transition to using IAM deny policies to manage MCP usage. For detailed instructions, refer to the documentation on controlling MCP use with IAM.

2026-02-17.content:
After March 17, 2026, when you enable Firestore, the Firestore
MCP server is automatically enabled.

summary.title: Firestore MCP server enabled by default
summary.summary: Starting March 17, 2026, the Firestore MCP server will be automatically enabled for all new Firestore instances. This change ensures enhanced performance and functionality for your applications from the moment you enable Firestore.

2026-02-10.content:
You can now use the [Firestore remote MCP server](https://docs.cloud.google.com/firestore/native/docs/use-firestore-mcp).
The Firestore remote MCP server lets you interact with documents stored
in a Firestore database from your AI application.

This feature is in [Preview](https://cloud.google.com/products/#product-launch-stages).

summary.title: Interact with Firestore from AI apps
summary.summary: You can now use the Firestore remote MCP server to interact with documents stored in a Firestore database from your AI application. This feature is currently in Preview.

2026-02-02.content:
The Firestore databases page in the Google Cloud console now includes
a status column. Possible statuses include:

* Ready
* Cloning is in progress
* Restoring from backup is in progress
* Deleted
* Failed

For the cloning and restore statuses, the status column updates upon completion.

summary.title: New Firestore Database Statuses
summary.summary: The Firestore databases page now displays a status column, showing statuses like Ready, Cloning, Restoring, Deleted, or Failed. This provides better visibility into your database's current state and ongoing operations.

2026-01-15.content:
Firestore Enterprise edition now supports Native mode and the Pipeline operations interface.

Pipeline operations are a new query interface for Firestore.
This interface provides advanced query functionality that includes complex
expressions. It also adds support for many new functions like `min`, `max`,
`substring`, `regex_match` and `array_contains_all`.

With Firestore Enterprise edition in Native mode,
index creation is also completely optional, streamlining the process of developing new queries.

To learn more about Pipeline operations,
see the [query interfaces overview](https://docs.cloud.google.com/firestore/native/docs/query-data/understanding-core-pipelines).

This feature is available in [Preview](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages).

summary.title: Firestore Enterprise Edition Enhancements
summary.summary: Firestore Enterprise Edition now supports Native mode and the new Pipeline operations interface, offering advanced query capabilities and optional index creation for a streamlined development experience. This preview feature includes new functions like min, max, and regex_match.

2025-11-21.content: Support for Object as document `_id` identifier.

summary.title: Object ID Support
summary.summary: We now support Object as a document _id identifier.

2025-10-27.content:
The [database clone feature](https://docs.cloud.google.com/firestore/native/docs/manage-databases#clone-database) is now
supported at the General Availability ([GA](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages)) level.

summary.title: Database Clone Feature Now Generally Available
summary.summary: The database clone feature is now supported at the General Availability (GA) level. This feature allows for easier management of databases.

2025-09-23.content: You can now query your databases and update data using the [dedicated Gemini CLI extension for Firestore](https://cloud.google.com/firestore/native/docs/connect-ide-using-mcp-toolbox#about-gemini-cli-extension). This feature is available in beta.

summary.title: Gemini CLI extension for Firestore
summary.summary: Query and update your data using the new Gemini CLI extension for Firestore. Available in beta.

2025-09-02.content: Use [Query insights](https://cloud.google.com/firestore/native/docs/query-insights) to view query performance metrics for your database. This feature is now generally available ([GA](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages)).

summary.title: Query insights now GA
summary.summary: Query insights for Firestore are now generally available. You can use this feature to view query performance metrics for your database.

2025-08-01.content: You can [clone an existing database](https://cloud.google.com/firestore/native/docs/manage-databases#clone-database) at a selected timestamp into a new database. This feature is available in [Preview](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages).

summary.title: Clone Database
summary.summary: Clone your existing database to a new database.
